findings.title: Unverified Interaction
findings.description: It is possible for a trader to implement and provide a token with the possibility to change decimals at any period in time. As the DeXe system relies on decimals during price calculation, internal logic may be corrupted

detector.description:
Reentrancy in TraderPoolRiskyProposal.invest(uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#116-175):
	External calls:
	- _transferAndMintLP(proposalId,user,lpInvestment,baseInvestment) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#153)
		- returndata = address(token).functionCall(data,SafeERC20: low-level call failed) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol#93)
		- IERC20(_parentTraderPoolInfo.baseToken).safeTransferFrom(_parentTraderPoolInfo.parentPoolAddress,address(this),baseInvestment.from18(_parentTraderPoolInfo.baseTokenDecimals)) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolProposal.sol#123-127)
		- response = IERC1155ReceiverUpgradeable(to).onERC1155Received(operator,from,id,amount,data) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC1155/ERC1155Upgradeable.sol#428-436)
		- ITraderPoolMemberHook(_parentTraderPoolInfo.parentPoolAddress).checkJoin(user) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolProposal.sol#194)
		- (success,returndata) = target.call{value: value}(data) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol#137)
		- ITraderPoolMemberHook(_parentTraderPoolInfo.parentPoolAddress).checkLeave(user) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolProposal.sol#181)
	- _investActivePortfolio(proposalId,baseInvestment,baseToExchange,lpInvestment,new address[](0),minPositionOut) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#166-173)
		- priceFeed.normalizedExchangeFromExact(inToken,outToken,amountIn,optionalPath,minAmountOut) (contracts/libs/price-feed/PriceFeedLocal.sol#28-35)
		- amountGot = priceFeed.normExchangeFromExact(_parentTraderPoolInfo.baseToken,info.token,baseToExchange,optionalPath,minPositionOut) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#394-400)
	External calls sending eth:
	- _transferAndMintLP(proposalId,user,lpInvestment,baseInvestment) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#153)
		- (success,returndata) = target.call{value: value}(data) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol#137)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _investActivePortfolio(proposalId,baseInvestment,baseToExchange,lpInvestment,new address[](0),minPositionOut) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#166-173)
		- info.lpLocked += lpInvestment (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#390)
		- info.balanceBase += baseInvestment - baseToExchange (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#391)
		- info.balancePosition += amountGot (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#402)

	- TraderPoolRiskyProposal._divestActivePortfolio(uint256,uint256,uint256) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#414-447)
	- TraderPoolRiskyProposal._divestProposalTrader(uint256,uint256) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#449-456)
	- TraderPoolRiskyProposal._investActivePortfolio(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address[],uint256) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#380-412)
	- TraderPoolRiskyProposal.changeProposalRestrictions(uint256,ITraderPoolRiskyProposal.ProposalLimits) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#56-65)
	- TraderPoolRiskyProposal.create(string,address,ITraderPoolRiskyProposal.ProposalLimits,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address[]) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#67-114)

detector.description:
TraderPoolRiskyProposal.invest(uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#116-175) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- require(bool,string)(info.proposalLimits.timestampLimit == 0 || block.timestamp <= info.proposalLimits.timestampLimit,TPRP: proposal is closed) (contracts/trader/TraderPoolRiskyProposal.sol#127-131)

findings.title: Flashloan Attack, Front Running Attack
findings.description: The library uses Uniswapâ€™s getAmountsOut and getAmountsIn functions to determine the exchange rate for the assets. Those functions provide the price based on the current state of a liquidity pool that may be easily manipulated by flasholans.

findings.title: Requirements Violation
findings.description: In a risky pool, traders can trade any token, even those created by them, and add liquidity to Uniswap. This allows the trader to always be in profit by selling their tokens at a Higher price, and closing DeXe trades at a loss.

findings.title: Highly Permissive Role Access
findings.description: The owner of the contract could change commissions at any period of time. The upper bound limit for the commission is not set up. This may lead to the manipulation of fees.

findings.title: Requirements Violation
findings.description: According to the documentation, it should be possible to view users and their deposits in an insurance pool. However, the functionality is not implemented.

findings.title: Highly Permissive Role Access
findings.description: The owner of the contract may change validators at any moment

findings.title: Integer Overflow
findings.description: The function _setERC721Address has the require(nftsTotalSupply > 0) check implemented. However, due to downcasting of nftsTotalSupply to uint128, this condition could be bypassed.

findings.title: Denial of Service Vulnerability
findings.description: In case of setting voting duration close to the uint64 max value, voteEnd voting field may be overflowed and newly created votings can come to a Defeated state.

findings.title: Highly Permissive Role Access
findings.description: The injector is able to change the DeXe token address on the contract. This may lead to users being unable to withdraw their deposits and the injector may take control over the insurance pool.

findings.title: Denial of Service Vulnerability
findings.description: Each new proposal creates a new structure with snapshotId as its unique identifier. snapshotId is capped by a uint32 type, which has a max value of 4294967295. The potential attacker may max out this value in the event of a potential gas price drop.

findings.title: Access Control Violation; Race Conditions
findings.description: Since, for the first time, the setter functions could be called by anyone, there is a risk of race conditions that may result in the inconsistent state of the contract. This may lead to access to critical state variables by an unauthorized user.

findings.title: Upgradeability Issues
findings.description: The contracts do not follow the upgradability best practices by not adding a gap in the contract storage.

findings.title: Requirements Violation; Misleading Naming
findings.description: The buyInsurance function does not reflect exactly what happens with the user funds.

findings.title: Best Practice Violation - Unfinalized Functionality
findings.description: It is not possible to execute an external proposal even if a quorum is reached. This may lead to double execution of the proposal off-chain as the proposal state could not be updated.

findings.title: Contradiction - Denial of Service
findings.description: The onlyValidator modifier uses current user balances to identify validators. However, voting is only possible for those who have balances at the moment of proposal creation. This may lead to an inability to reach a quorum on proposals due to some validators not passing the modifier.

findings.title: Contradiction - Invalid Return Action
findings.vulnerability_subclass: Improper Check or Handling of Exceptional Conditions
findings.description: The function contains the check (bytes(poolName).length == 0) which returns address(0). This might cause a logic error, because the relying code might not expect a zero address. Instead, an error should be thrown clearly marking that the input parameter is invalid.

findings.title: Inconsistent Data - Sign of Unfinalized Code
findings.description: The _validateGovPoolWithTokenSaleParameters function contains the check require(parameters. ... Executors[0] == address(0)). If the value should always be equal to 0x0 it may be directly overwritten there.

findings.title: Best Practice Violation - Unstable Import
findings.vulnerability_subclass: Use of Unmaintained Third Party Components
findings.description: The project allows different versions of a custom import @dlsl/dev-modules: ^1.8.1. This may lead to unexpected and untested code being deployed.

findings.title: Floating Pragma
findings.vulnerability_subclass: Use of Unmaintained Third Party Components
findings.description: Locking the pragma helps ensure that contracts do not accidentally get deployed using an outdated compiler version

findings.title: Redundant Import
findings.description: Unused imports should be removed from the contracts.

findings.title: Missing Events
findings.description: Events for critical state changes should be emitted for tracking things off-chain.

findings.title: Unindexed Events
findings.description: Having indexed parameters in the events makes it easier to search for these events using indexed parameters as filters.

findings.title: Function Which May Be Declared Private
findings.description: There is no added value in declaring non-public functions as internal in a non-inherited contract.

findings.title: Redundant Statement
findings.description: The onlyValidator check on the functions is redundant as the functions call _beforeTokenTransfer functions internally, which is under the modifier.

findings.title: Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: Address parameters are used without checking against the possibility of 0x0.
